title: Everyday English Course 51
description: Improve your English comprehension skills through short everyday conversations and situational dialogues.

sections.title: Section 1: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

variables.a: Where has the key been found?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: Hi, my name is Drake.
W: Hi, I'm Maria.
M: Are you traveling from the U.S. as well? I didn't expect this train to be so nice!
W: I'm actually from France. I'm going to Spain next.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
M: Hi, my name is Drake.
W: Hi, I'm Maria.
M: Are you traveling from the U.S. as well? I didn't expect this train to be so nice!
W: I'm actually from France. I'm going to Spain next.
{a}

variables.a: Where does the man probably come from?

answerOptions: The clothes the woman is wearing.
instances.correctAnswer: The clothes the woman is wearing.

variables.a: What are the speakers talking about?
What are the speakers talking about?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: Let's back up. Where was I?
W: You were talking about your trip to South Africa. I bet you had a great time.
M: Yes, we did. In fact, you know what we encountered.
W: A long-last friend?
M: Come on! A lion.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
M: Let's back up. Where was I?
W: You were talking about your trip to South Africa. I bet you had a great time.
M: Yes, we did. In fact, you know what we encountered.
W: A long-last friend?
M: Come on! A lion.
{a}

variables.a: What is the man mainly talking about?

answerOptions: She has some aspirins in her bag.
She put the aspirins in her bag.

variables.a: What does the woman mean?

answerOptions: She promised to help the man.
She came a long way to meet the man.
She took the man to where he wanted to go.
instances.correctAnswer: She took the man to where he wanted to go.

variables.a: Why did the man thank the woman?

answerOptions: A table for two by the window.
A table for two in the comer.
A table for three in the comer.
instances.correctAnswer: A table for three in the comer.

variables.a: What kind of table does the woman want?
Where are the two speakers?
Why didn't the woman enjoy the dinner party?

sections.title: Section 2: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

answerOptions: There were too many questions in the examination.
The examination was well beyond the course content.
The examination questions were somewhat too difficult.
instances.correctAnswer: The examination was well beyond the course content.

variables.a: What does the man mean?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: Hey, John! Were you in the literature class yesterday?
M: No. I couldn't make it. Weren't you there. either?
W: No. I wasn't. I was hoping you could tell me the reading assignment.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
W: Hey, John! Were you in the literature class yesterday?
M: No. I couldn't make it. Weren't you there. either?
W: No. I wasn't. I was hoping you could tell me the reading assignment.
{a}

answerOptions: Go to the class at once.

variables.a: What do you guess they'll do?

answerOptions: Moving on to the next item.

variables.a: What does the woman suggest doing?
Who has got the pen now?

answerOptions: The man is inviting the woman to dinner.
The woman is too busy to join the man for dinner.
The woman is a friend of the Stevensons.
instances.correctAnswer: The man is inviting the woman to dinner.

variables.a: What do we learn from the conversation?

answerOptions: She was tired of the work.

answerOptions: She was given a new job.

instances.correctAnswer: She was criticized for being late.

variables.a: What happened to Miss Gray?
How did the man feel about the girl's speech?

answerOptions: Margaret wanted to return some magazines to the woman.
Margaret wanted to get some magazines back from the woman.
Margaret wanted to borrow some magazines from the woman.
instances.correctAnswer: Margaret wanted to get some magazines back from the woman.

variables.a: What do we learn from the conversation?

answerOptions: He plans to sell the books to a collector.

instances.correctAnswer: The books probably aren't worth a lot of money.

variables.a: What does the man mean?

sections.title: Section 3: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: I don't know what Jim's got to grumble about. My work load has doubled in the past year and I still manage. He is not doing anything different from when he arrived, as far as I can see.
M: Yeah, but he's not as energetic as you are. Well, no one is. But the boss doesn't blame me when I get a bit behind. He is very understanding with me. But with Jim, he goes on and on.
W: I haven't noticed it. But you're probably right. I wonder why he does it.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
W: I don't know what Jim's got to grumble about. My work load has doubled in the past year and I still manage. He is not doing anything different from when he arrived, as far as I can see.
M: Yeah, but he's not as energetic as you are. Well, no one is. But the boss doesn't blame me when I get a bit behind. He is very understanding with me. But with Jim, he goes on and on.
W: I haven't noticed it. But you're probably right. I wonder why he does it.
{a}

W: I haven't noticed it. But you're probably right. I wonder why he does it.
{a}

answerOptions: The boss is unfair to him.
He has too much to do.
instances.correctAnswer: The boss is unfair to him.

variables.a: These people are talking about their colleague, Jim. What's Jim's problem?

answerOptions: He tried calling the woman but failed.
He had no time to call the woman.
He called the woman but she was out.
instances.correctAnswer: He tried calling the woman but failed.

variables.a: What does the man mean?

answerOptions: Yes, she does. But not now.
instances.correctAnswer: Yes, she does. But not now.

variables.a: Does the woman like to lend the book to the man?

answerOptions: Because the weather is very hot.
Because they will keep their eyes safe.
instances.correctAnswer: Because they will keep their eyes safe.

variables.a: Why do the workers wear thick glasses?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: Look at the clouds, I'm afraid it'll rain soon.
M: You could be right, but it's not what the weather report said.
W: What did the weather report say?
M: It said it'd be fine all day today.
{a}
